hola: Possibly from interjections like 'hala/ola'; old call for attention; h- is silent.
adiós: From 'a Dios' (to God), a parting blessing.
familia: From Latin 'familia' referring to household members.
escuela: From Latin 'schola', originally Greek for leisure study.
libro: From Latin 'liber', inner bark used as writing material.
camisa: From Late Latin 'camisia', a tunic or shirt.
playa: From Late Latin 'plagia', level shore or beach.
color: From Latin 'color', referring to hue or tone.
amigo: From Latin 'amicus', meaning friend or ally.
coche: Possibly from Hungarian 'kocsi', a carriage from Kocs village.
trabajar: From Vulgar Latin '*tripaliare', to torture with a 'tripalium'; later to toil.
viajar: From French 'voyager', to make a voyage.
hotel: From French 'hôtel', a place receiving guests.
mercado: From Latin 'mercatus', a place of trade.
restaurante: From French 'restaurant', a place to restore with food.
lunes: From Latin 'lunae dies', day of the moon.
martes: From Latin 'Martis dies', day of Mars.
miércoles: From Latin 'Mercurii dies', day of Mercury.
jueves: From Latin 'Jovis dies', day of Jupiter.
viernes: From Latin 'Veneris dies', day of Venus.
febrero: From Latin 'Februarius', linked to purification festival Februa.
